meta.content: Looking for help during the school closure?
Breakfast, lunch and a snack will be pr

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.h3: All in. Every Child, Every Day, Whatever It Takes!

div.h1: Article: Looking for help during the school closure?

h1.span: Looking for help during the school closure?

span.p:
Breakfast, lunch and a snack will be provided daily during the closure to any student who wants it. If you want to receive these bagged meals at no charge, please contact your school.
District Three will continue to deliver food during spring break to help our families in need.
However, starting Monday, March 30, the delivery schedule changed.
We are still be providing five days worth of food (breakfast, lunch and a snack) but deliveries are now on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays.
You can also pick up food from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at our three sites: Gettys D. Broome High School, Pacolet Elementary School and Cowpens Middle School.
Please contact your student's school if you have any questions or concerns.

District Three understands these are difficult times for many of our students and families. We are here to help and provide guidance to make sure your family is safe and fed.
If you need support or referrals to agencies that can provide assistance, please contact Ruth Schoonover at 279-6022 or [email protected]
Please also take a look at SC211.org for lists of information and services that might be able to help.
Here are a list of local numbers you can call for help.
You can read the eLearning plan here.

Click here to go to our eLearning page for help with instruction and getting started.
Here are a list of resources during the closure to help you during this time:

li.a: Scholastic is offering free online courses so your kids can keep learning while schools are closed
This website from the state shares mental health help, hot spot locations, SCETV education programming, updates from the governor and press releases!
AT&T is offering Internet to low-income households
Comcast Announces Comprehensive COVID-19 Response to Help Keep Americans Connected to the Internet
Want to watch an astronaut read in space? Click here!
Our local library has tens of thousands of books, movies and audiobooks you can rent online.
United Way launches coronavirus relief fund
Support for families helping students learn at home
Here are a list of restaurants offering free meals to kids as schools remain closed
Here are a list of hot spot locations if you need Internet
Here are a list of free educational resources during the closure
Charter to Offer Free Access to Spectrum Broadband and Wi-Fi For 60 Days For New K-12 and College Student Households and More
Here are a list of "virtual" field trips you can take
Time for Kids Digital Library is free for the rest of the school year
Here are a list of apps the library recommends while it's closed
Need access to school meals during the closure? Email us here

br.text-node: These cell phone companies are helping with Internet access during the closure:

li.span: stating that providers will waive late fees, not cutoff service for lack of payment, and open hot-spots.
: offers free WiFi for 2 months to low income families plus all Xfinity hot-spots are free to the public during this time
: offers open hot-spots, unlimited data to existing customers, and $10/month plans to low income families
: no special offers, but following the FCC agreement.

: follows FCC agreement, provides unlimited data to existing customers, and, starting Tuesday, 3/17/2020, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge (I expect others will follow).
: follows FCC agreement, plus unlimited data to existing customers, and, coming soon, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge (I expect others will follow).

span.p: Here are more local numbers to call for help:

ul.li: United Way of The Piedmont - Dial 211
Salvation Army - 576-6670 for appt. Help with rent and utilities
Cannon's Methodist Church - Food Pantry April 4th- 9 am - 11 am
First Baptist The Bridge on Green Street - Food distribution on Tuesdays and Thursdays- 9 am - 12 pm
DSS applications for SNAP and Medicaid - 1-800-726-8774 (select option 1)
Total Ministries - Help with food and financial assistance - 585-9167 by appointments only
Crisis Response Mobile Helpline for Mental Health Crisis - 1-833-364-2274
